docker-compose-host.yml
files.content:
version: '2.1'

services:
  hub:
    image: elgalu/selenium
    network_mode: host
    volumes:
      - /dev/shm:/dev/shm
    privileged: true
    environment:
      - SELENIUM_HUB_PORT=${SELENIUM_HUB_PORT-4444}
      - PICK_ALL_RANDOM_PORTS=true
      - GRID=true
      - CHROME=false
      - FIREFOX=false

  chrome:
    image: elgalu/selenium
    network_mode: host
    volumes:
      - /dev/shm:/dev/shm
    privileged: true
    environment:
      - SELENIUM_HUB_PORT=${SELENIUM_HUB_PORT-4444}
      - PICK_ALL_RANDOM_PORTS=true
      - GRID=false
      - CHROME=true
      - FIREFOX=false

  firefox:
    image: elgalu/selenium
    network_mode: host
    volumes:
      - /dev/shm:/dev/shm
    privileged: true
    environment:
      - SELENIUM_HUB_PORT=${SELENIUM_HUB_PORT-4444}
      - PICK_ALL_RANDOM_PORTS=true
      - GRID=false
      - CHROME=false
      - FIREFOX=true

  mock:
    image: elgalu/google_adwords_mock
    network_mode: host
    tty: true
    environment:
      - MOCK_SERVER_PORT=8280

files.name: docker-compose-scales.yml
files.content:
# The purpose of this -scales example is to run 1 hub, N chromes, N firefox
#
# Usage:
#  docker-compose -f docker-compose-scales.yml -p grid up --force-recreate
# How to scale it:
#  docker-compose -f docker-compose-scales.yml -p grid scale hub=1 chrome=2 firefox=1
version: '3'

services:
  hub:
    image: elgalu/selenium
    ports:
      - 4444:4444
    volumes:
      - /dev/shm:/dev/shm
    privileged: true
    environment:
      - SELENIUM_HUB_HOST=hub
      - SELENIUM_HUB_PORT=4444
      - GRID=true
      - CHROME=false
      - FIREFOX=false

  chrome:
    image: elgalu/selenium
    depends_on:
      - hub
    volumes:
      - /dev/shm:/dev/shm
    privileged: true
    environment:
      - SELENIUM_HUB_HOST=hub
      - SELENIUM_HUB_PORT=4444
      - SELENIUM_NODE_HOST={{CONTAINER_IP}}
      - SCREEN_WIDTH=1300
      - SCREEN_HEIGHT=999
      - VIDEO=false
      - AUDIO=false
      - GRID=false
      - CHROME=true
      - FIREFOX=false

  firefox:
    image: elgalu/selenium
    depends_on:
      - hub
    volumes:
      - /dev/shm:/dev/shm
    privileged: true
    environment:
      - SELENIUM_HUB_HOST=hub
      - SELENIUM_HUB_PORT=4444
      - SELENIUM_NODE_HOST={{CONTAINER_IP}}
      - SCREEN_WIDTH=1300
      - SCREEN_HEIGHT=999
      - VIDEO=false
      - AUDIO=false
      - GRID=false
      - CHROME=false
      - FIREFOX=true

files.name: docker-compose-tests.yml
files.content:
# The purpose of this -test example is for the e2e tests of this project
#
# Usage:
#  docker-compose -p grid up --force-recreate
#  docker-compose -p grid scale mock=1 hub=1 chrome=3 firefox=3
version: '2.1'

services:
  hub:
    image: elgalu/selenium
    ports:
      # Note 24444 is the default SELENIUM_HUB_PORT inside the container
      #  and  4444 will be mapped into your host for easy access.
      - 4444:4444
      # We need a fixed port range to expose VNC
      # due to a bug in Docker for Mac beta (1.12)
      # https://forums.docker.com/t/docker-for-mac-beta-not-forwarding-ports/8658/6
      - ${VNC_FROM_PORT-40650}-${VNC_TO_PORT-40700}:${VNC_FROM_PORT-40650}-${VNC_TO_PORT-40700}
      # e.g. (hard-coded)
      # - 40650-40700:40650-40700
    volumes:
      - /dev/shm:/dev/shm
    privileged: true
    environment:
      - DEBUG=false
      - PICK_ALL_RANDOM_PORTS=true
      - SELENIUM_HUB_HOST=hub
      - SELENIUM_HUB_PORT=4444
      - GRID=true
      - CHROME=false
      - FIREFOX=false
      - MOCK_SERVER_HOST=mock

  chrome:
    image: elgalu/selenium
    depends_on:
      - hub
    volumes:
      - /dev/shm:/dev/shm
    privileged: true
    environment:
      - DEBUG=false
      - PICK_ALL_RANDOM_PORTS=true
      - SELENIUM_HUB_HOST=hub
      - SELENIUM_HUB_PORT=4444
      - SELENIUM_NODE_HOST={{CONTAINER_IP}}
      - VNC_FROM_PORT=${VNC_FROM_PORT-40650}
      - VNC_TO_PORT=${VNC_TO_PORT-40700}
      - SCREEN_WIDTH=1300
      - SCREEN_HEIGHT=999
      - VIDEO=${VIDEO-false}
      - AUDIO=${AUDIO-false}
      - GRID=false
      - CHROME=true
      - FIREFOX=false

  firefox:
    image: elgalu/selenium
    depends_on:
      - hub
    volumes:
      - /dev/shm:/dev/shm
    privileged: true
    environment:
      - DEBUG=false
      - PICK_ALL_RANDOM_PORTS=true
      - SELENIUM_HUB_HOST=hub
      - SELENIUM_HUB_PORT=4444
      - SELENIUM_NODE_HOST={{CONTAINER_IP}}
      - VNC_FROM_PORT=${VNC_FROM_PORT-40650}
      - VNC_TO_PORT=${VNC_TO_PORT-40700}
      - SCREEN_WIDTH=1300
      - SCREEN_HEIGHT=999
      - VIDEO=${VIDEO-false}
      - AUDIO=${AUDIO-false}
      - GRID=false
      - CHROME=false
      - FIREFOX=true

  mock:
    image: elgalu/google_adwords_mock
    depends_on:
      - hub
    tty: true
    environment:
      - MOCK_SERVER_PORT=8280

files.name: docker-compose.yml
files.content:
# The purpose of this `docker-compose.yml` example is to run 1 hub, 1 chrome, 1 firefox
# i.e. this example doesn't scale, but there is another file for that: docker-compose-scales.yml
# i.e. this example doesn't support `docker-compose scale`
#
# If you try to scale this one you will get `Bind for 0.0.0.0:6080 failed: port is already allocated`
#
# Usage:
#  docker-compose -p grid up --force-recreate
version: '3'

services:
  hub:
    image: elgalu/selenium
    ports:
      - 4444:4444
    volumes:
      - /dev/shm:/dev/shm
    privileged: true
    environment:
      - SELENIUM_HUB_HOST=hub
      - SELENIUM_HUB_PORT=4444
      - GRID=true
      - CHROME=false
      - FIREFOX=false

  chrome:
    image: elgalu/selenium
    depends_on:
      - hub
    ports:
      # VNC: See what's going on by connecting your VNC client to 0.0.0.0:5900
      - 5900:25900
      # noVNC: See what's going on by hitting http://0.0.0.0:6080 in your browser
      #        Important: http://127.0.0.1:6080 works but http://localhost:6080 doesn't
      - 6080:26080
    volumes:
      - /dev/shm:/dev/shm
    privileged: true
    environment:
      - NOVNC=true
      - SELENIUM_HUB_HOST=hub
      - SELENIUM_HUB_PORT=4444
      - SELENIUM_NODE_HOST={{CONTAINER_IP}}
      - SCREEN_WIDTH=1300
      - SCREEN_HEIGHT=999
      - VIDEO=false
      - AUDIO=false
      - GRID=false
      - CHROME=true
      - FIREFOX=false

  firefox:
    image: elgalu/selenium
    depends_on:
      - hub
    ports:
      # VNC: See what's going on by connecting your VNC client to 0.0.0.0:5901
      - 5901:25900
      # noVNC: See what's going on by hitting http://0.0.0.0:6081 in your browser
      - 6081:26080
    volumes:
      - /dev/shm:/dev/shm
    privileged: true
    environment:
      - NOVNC=true
      - SELENIUM_HUB_HOST=hub
      - SELENIUM_HUB_PORT=4444
      - SELENIUM_NODE_HOST={{CONTAINER_IP}}
      - SCREEN_WIDTH=1300
      - SCREEN_HEIGHT=999
      - VIDEO=false
      - AUDIO=false
      - GRID=false
      - CHROME=false
      - FIREFOX=true
